TITLE: śivadharmottaram
TEXT: kṛtvā vidhim imaṃ bhaktyā vidyādānaphalaṃ labhet ||
yasya yāvad bhaved vittaṃ sa tasyehānusārataḥ |
TR: As many letters are in the manuscript of the knowledge of Śiva, so many thousand years the donor will live in the town of Śiva.
Having rescued ten ancestors and ten descendants, having brought to Heaven [his] mother, father and lawful wife, he will attain Śiva.
Surrounded by his queens, accompanied by all [his] servants, the king, through the power of the gift of knowledge, will go to the town of Śiva
APP: \vcmanojavair a- \msNKA12\msNK28\msNKo77\msGP74; manoramair na \msNC45, manoramyair a- \msNK82\msE, manojajaivar \msGP43cm
TR: He will have fun for an imperishable time with countless auspicious [flying] chariots, furnished with everything he desires, swift as thought.
APP: \vc sarvajñaḥ \msALL; sarvajña \msNKA12\oo paripūrṇātmā \msN\msGP74; paripūrṇaś{ }ca \msGP43 \vd dvitīya \msALL; dvitīyam \msNKo77
TR: He will be endowed with the sovereignty of the supreme eight qualities, powerful on everything, omniscient, fully satisfied, like a second Śaṅkara.
As the supreme Lord is supreme among all immortals, in the same way the gift of knowledge is acknowledged as supreme among all gifts.
The one who, having placed, in exact accordance with this procedure, the manuscript of the knowledge of Śiva in a house of flowers, will worship it in the hermitage of Śiva,

In the day of full moon of the month āṣāḍha, in the light of garlands of lamps, and having done worshio in the day of full moon in the month Vaiśākha as well, this person will take the fruit of a gift of knowledge
NOTE: pāda a: pū- dam. in \msNKA12; pāda d: —bhet dam. in \msNKA12
TR: Listen to the fruit resulting from the merits of that person who, having transcribed the best among the auspicious manuscripts, would present [it] to someone who is versed in the knowledge of Śiva:
As big is the number of this [manuscript’s] extremely auspicious leaves in the manuscript, for so many thousand yugas he is honoured in the world of Śiva;
APP: \va yat patrayantra° ; yat patraṃ yantra° \msNC45 , yaḥ patramātra° \msGP43 , yaḥ putramātra° \msGP74\oo °sūtrādyaṃ \msALL ; sūtrādya° \msNK28 \vb maṣībhājana° ; masirāśraya° \msNKA12, masimāśraya° \msNK28\oo °lekhanī \msN ; lekhinīṃ \msP
TR: Having presented, according to [his] faith and wealth, even just one of the auxiliary instruments of knowledge — which [are] leaves, stands, threads and so on, ink-pot and pen, a śarayantra seat, unguents, beds, good food, a salary, and so on,
TEXT: yadvā tadvā mahat sūkṣmaṃ vidhānena tu yad bhavet ||
APP: vd vidhānena \msNC45; vināyena \msNKA12\msNK28\msP\oo tu yad \msNC45; na tat \msNK28\msP
TR: And anything else that is employed for this purpose; everything, big or small, that would conform to the procedure
NOTE: pāda a: —tyevamā— dam. in \msNKA12; pāda b: —rthamu— dam. in \msNKA12; pāda d: tuyatbhave— dam. in \msNKA12
TR: — He is honoured in the world of Śiva with great enjoyments.
APP: \va pustakāstaraṇaṃ dattvā \msNC45\msNK28\msGP43; pustakātaraṇaṃ dattvā \msNKA12, pustakāstaradattvā sa \msGP74 \vb sadvastraṃ ca ; svahastā<.> \msNKA12, sadvastrāṃ sa \msNK28 , sadvastraś{ }ca \msP
tadvāsanavitānaṃ vā \msNC45\msNKA12; tadvāsanaṃ vitānāṃ vā \msNK28 , tadāsanaṃ vitānaṃ vā \msGP43, tadāsanam adhādattvā \msGP74
TR: Having donated a carpet for the manuscript and a beautiful cloth, proportionate to the measures [of the manuscript], or a cover for its box, he is honoured in the world of Śiva.
As many are the whole number of threads in the cloth of this [manuscript], for so many thousand yugas he will obtain great enjoyments
One who offers a gift of food to one who is versed in the knowledge of Śiva will take the fruit of a gift of knowledge without interruption, until the end.
NOTE: \—jī— in \msNC45 pāda b: —ī— partly deleted in the text, —jī— copied again in margine
APP:
\va etad \msALL ; edad \msGP74 pañcānāṃ pañcavarṣāṇi vidyādānaphalaṃ labhet || pāda c: pañca° dam. in \msNK28
The one who would regularly do this for five people whose souls rejoice in the Śaiva knowledge, for five years, this one will obtain the fruit of the gift of knowledge.
